result.execSummary:
The defendant Kristofer D. Ross was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kristofer D. Ross is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kristofer D. Ross was found guilty of Maintain Drug Trafficking Place, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: comply with any and all counseling recommended by the agent
no contact with Thao Kang or Zackory Beres
provide DNA Sample if not already done

timeConds.notes:
60 DAYS IN MARQUETTE COUNTY JAIL WITH HUBER. REPORT ON OR BEFORE JANUARY 4, 2016 BY 7:00 P.M. CLEAN & SOBER.
MAY SERVE IN GREEN LAKE COUNTY.
HUBER TO INCLUDE EMPLOYMENT AND CARE TAKING OF HIS ELDERLY RELATIVES.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kristofer D. Ross

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kristofer D. Ross in court with attorney Jon R. Wilsnack.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states plea agreement to Ct. 1.  Ct. 2 to be dismissed.  Atty Wilsnack agrees.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Ct. 1.  Ct. 2 to be dismissed.

Atty Hendee asks the court to follow the joint recommendation.
Atty Wilsnack makes sentencing arguments.

BY THE COURT:  Ct. 1:  Withhold Sentence; 24 months Probation with conditions:
*60 days in the Marquette County Jail w/huber
  Report on or before January 4, 2016 by 7:00pm, clean & sober.
*May serve in Green Lake County
*Huber to include employment and care taking of his elderly relatives
*Court Costs = $268.00
 *DNA Sample + $250.00 Surcharge (DNA Sample if not already done so)
*Comply with any and all counseling recommended by the Agent
*No contact with Thao Kang or Zackory Beres
bond to be applied

  **Court advises defendant that they have been convicted of a Felony and advises rights of voting privileges and of owning a firearm.
Ct. 2 to be dismissed.

Defendant Kristofer D. Ross in court with attorney Jon R. Wilsnack.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states that in speaking with Atty Wilsnack; the defendant will be waiving the Prelim today.  Atty Wilsnack agrees and has discussed the waiver with his client.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the waiver.  Court accepts the waiver of the Prelim.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.

Atty Hendee files the information with the Court.  Atty Wilsnack states that the Defendant received a copy of the information and waives its reading. Atty Wilsnack enters a Not Guilty plea.

BY THE COURT:  Not Guilty plea entered.
Set for return.
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for November 5, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

Defendant Kristofer D. Ross in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that the time limits were waived at the bond hearing.  Court questions the defendant regarding counsel.  Defendant would like a little more time to get counsel.

BY THE COURT:  Reset one time to give the defendant time to get counsel.
bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 2, 2015 at 10:00 am.
*No contact with Thao Khang or Zakory Beres.

Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Court finds probable cause to support the charges.
Court questions defendant.  Defendant waives time limits for preliminary hearing.

Defendant Kristofer D. Ross by video, in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee requests $500 cash bond with conditions.  BY THE COURT:  Court sets cash bond.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 22, 2015 at 10:30 am.
